title: Fleet Footwork feels like an oddity.
body:
Fleet Footwork is a keystone that is specifically nerfed for ranged champs, but nearly every good adc currently uses it due to its inherent safety. Meanwhile melee champs that could use it better or might find it valuable (Fiora and jax notably) don't use it due to there being better options. Is there a way to make this keystone have an identity outside of it's healing? 

My idea for it would be to give it something akin to Celerity's old adaptive dmg based on movement speed. That way it would be a viable alternative to Conqueror while also being distinctly different. Any other suggestions?

replies.body: Akali uses it a lot in pro from what I have seen. Also some other melee solo laners in hard lanes. Sejuani too if she is against trundle.

I suppose so. Just dislike how it could be better but it's just the "Hard matchup" keystone. From what I understand the melees that use it a majority of the time are Akali and Kass, but other than that everyone else uses it rarely or not at all.

{{champion:36}} Jungle or {{champion:23}} mostly use this rune.
Mundo can't proc aftershock or grasp on jungle so FF got a lot of potential on him (sustain) and as for tryndamere, he can't stack fast enough conqueror to make it work and PTA isn't really that good.
Fleet give him a decent amount of MS without give up the precision three for chasing people while they're running away (the ms steroid).
Probably phaserush would be better on him if he actually got a realistic all in combo rather than spin + AA
Sometime even {{champion:157}} {{champion:150}}(even tho he is half ranged) {{champion:75}} (has used it for a good amount of time).
I use it as a bottom lane Mundo and occasionally on Taric for the movement speed to help line up stuns.

Because melee champions got a better keystone , Conq , Some use PTA , and assassins use Electrocute , the only way to make it have it's identity is by overbuffing it which will make it broken so everyone takes it which is a big no

Yeah that's also fair. We wouldn't want another abusable keystone. When they released these runes they wanted each of them to have a distinct trait to differentiate them from the others, but this keystone just feels like a safer taste of blood. A _Keystone_ shouldn't be interchangeable with a minor rune in any reality. 

The idea to add celerity's old passive to it wouldn't be too out there would it? Shave off some of the heal for some dmg applied to it. It's the one keystone for precision that doesn't provide any offensive capabilities other than a small dash, a bad one at that. The problem with celerity when the dmg was on it was that a minor rune is too splashable to have that strong of a buff. But a _keystone_ is a different story.
Your idea is to take a healing/MS keystone and... add damage to it? Do you work for Riot?
Ya caught me lol. Good point though it's an unnecessary change to say the least.

Fleet isn't weak. It just doesn't mesh too well with how melees interact with each other. The trades Adcs most commonly take contrasts the ones of melees in severity. 2 Adcs might trade a single ability and a single auto each, whereas melees would unload all of their abilities and some autos. Since melees all-in more often, it is  riskier to attempt proccing fleet on the wave due to the threat of an all-in and more valuable to have a stronger all-in.

That's why I was suggesting adding the old celerity adaptive damage to give it some use in all ins. It's not the best change I'll admit but it's something to start the thought process on how to make it better. I feel like it should be the keystone that rewards movement and sticking to your enemy.

Sometimes you gotta think about the matchups you might have. 

Fighters may not ever fully stack Conqueror and therefore may not get the true damage and sustain bonus. Fleet Footwork is guaranteed by the first basic attack but it will never allow you to increase you DPS.

The reason why you see the likes of Yasuo, Akali, Kassadin, etc. taking FF is because they don't fully commit to 5 attacks/abilities one and only one champion in most stages of the game since their AA reset combos aren't as quick or full like Darius, Morde, Jax, and Irelia. 

As a matter of fact Yasuo, Akali, Kassadin, Fiora, and the likes have a distinct attack pattern: get close, cast an ability, basic attack, retreat. Or may commit. But that's still only 1 or 2 offensive abilities used.

The other champs like Darius, Morde, Jax, Irelia, go all in with abilities and can net a lot of value with Conqueror by: closing the gap, basic attack, CC, basic attack, ability, basic attack, ulti or some similar variant.

Thing is, it only is nerfed for ranged vs minions, which is noticeable in a ranged vs ranged lane, but not much of a deal in ranged vs melee or actuall skirmishes and teamfights. 
What's more, ranged have acces to{{item:3094}} which charges it 25% faster and heals of towers and they have an easy time fitting {{item:3095}} into their built which increases heal and speedboost by 35%, so ranged with gear actually gain alot more from it than most melees. 

I would use it more on melees if it scaled less of ad and more per level, or if the ms boost lasted longer on melees and if melees would charge enrgized faster with AAs by default.
I also feel like the last nerf to it's AP ratio was to much, befor that i used it on diana, fizz, ekko and kassa, now it's really just for the bad matchups.

I like the idea of melee getting energized faster inherently. I'd also go for increased energy gain based on movement speed, something that is supposedly already there but lackluster in its implementation, though this would crop up problematic champs like Jhin and Ekko who already have built in Movement steroids.

I play a lot of yasuo, and I find that fleet is the best rune on him. When I use conqueror Remember back when keystone masteries where introduced and people forgot to make them and had the "X" on their mastery? That's how conqueror feels most of the time.
I feel like Yasuo and Fiora should use this way more than they do Conqueror. Conqueror is just too good to pass up in its current state 70% of the time.
i think conqueror is just overrated

I wish it was. The usefulness of it is lackluster early game, but when it hits lvl 8 or 9 and starts giving you 2 ad per stack it trumps most keystones. It's fleet healing on a constant passive with built in true damage conversion, giving you effectively 10-15% more damage due to everyone having innate resistances.

> but nearly every good adc currently uses it due to its inherent safety

Only Caitlyn and Jhin use it.

Everyone else is using Lethal Tempo or Press the Attack.


 

If anything they need to lighten the ranged limitations on fleet and make it more viable to other adcs besides those 2.
